intro: Achillea bipinnata, commonly known as the doubleleaf yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and dry grasslands. Achillea bipinnata is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
